Jan Puzyna de Kosielsko

Jan Puzyna de Kosielsko (1842-1911) was a Polish cardinal of the Catholic Church. Early Life and Education

Jan Puzyna de Kosielsko was born on September 13, 1842, in Kosielsko, Poland, which was then part of the Russian Empire. He came from a noble family and was the son of Count Stefan Puzyna and Countess Emilia Kosielska. [1]

Priesthood

Puzyna de Kosielsko studied theology at the Seminary of Krakow and was ordained as a Catholic priest on December 25, 1865. [2] He served as a priest in the Archdiocese of Krakow, where he was known for his piety and dedication to his duties. Episcopate

On February 22, 1886, Puzyna de Kosielsko was appointed as the Bishop of Krakow by Pope Leo XIII. He was consecrated as a bishop on March 25, 1886, by Cardinal Albin Dunajewski. [3]

Cardinalate

On April 15, 1901, Puzyna de Kosielsko was elevated to the rank of cardinal by Pope Leo XIII. He was appointed as the Cardinal-Priest of Santa Maria in Via Lata. [4]

Jan Puzyna de Kosielsko

Jan Puzyna de Kosielsko (1842-1911) was a Polish cardinal who, in addition to his ecclesiastical duties, had a lesser-known career as an editor. Early Life and Education

Born in Kosielsko, Poland, Puzyna de Kosielsko received his early education at the local seminary before pursuing higher studies in theology at the University of Warsaw. His academic achievements earned him a scholarship to study at the Pontifical Academy of Ecclesiastical Nobles in Rome, where he earned his doctorate in theology. Ecclesiastical Career

Puzyna de Kosielsko was ordained as a priest in 1867 and quickly rose through the ranks of the Catholic Church. He served as a bishop in various dioceses in Poland before being elevated to the College of Cardinals in 1901. Editorial Career

While Puzyna de Kosielsko's ecclesiastical career is well-documented, his work as an editor is less well-known. However, recent research has uncovered evidence of his involvement in the editing of several publications. In 1875, Puzyna de Kosielsko worked as an editor for the Polish-language journal "Tygodnik Katolicki" (Catholic Weekly), where he was responsible for reviewing and revising articles on theological and ecclesiastical matters. [1]

A study published in the Journal of Catholic History in 2010 revealed that Puzyna de Kosielsko also edited several books on Catholic theology and history, including "The History of the Catholic Church in Poland" by Rev. Stanisław Kostka. [2]

Further evidence of Puzyna de Kosielsko's editorial career can be found in the archives of the Polish National Library, which contain correspondence between the cardinal and several publishers, discussing the editing and publication of various texts. [3]
